description.en: The preceptor Bālabodhendra was the son of Kālahasti, and was called Bālaya, bereft of ignorance, attained the Supreme state of immortality on the fourth day of the dark fortnight of the month of Vaiśāka in the year Ānanda. His preceptor-ship was for thirty-seven years. He attained siddhi in Kāñci.

shlokas:
kAlahastisutabAlayAbhidhO bOdhasadgururabOdhavarjitaH.
Apa zAzvatapadaM vizuddham AnandamAdhavacaturthyaharmukhE..59..
